result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward H Stray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Dangerous Weapon-Person < 18, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.60(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable court costs and fees by June 24, 2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

**Court ordered defendant to remain in school.**

**Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.**
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.   FORTHWITH.   Huber for work privileges pursuant to 303.08 Wis. stats for work ONLY.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward H Stray

records.addlTxt: Denying Motion for Expunction, signed and filed
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, for review. cmc
Per request of Attorney Colleen Cullen.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: per clerical error/previous closer.  All huber language now showing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Dorothy H.

The Court ordered defendant to serve 50 days in the House of Correction FORTHWITH, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 1 (one) day time served. The Court granted Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for work ONLY: Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and fees by June 24, 2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Court ordered defendant to remain in school.
.
Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.
.

Defendant Edward H Stray in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Edward H Stray in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Court is in jury trial for today's proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward H Stray in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Court is in jury trial for today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edward H Stray in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. State needs to locate file. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edward H Stray in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Status conference held off the record, additional time needed to speak to DPA.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward H Stray in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.    Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Assistant District Attorney needs to talk to supervisor. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY; no possession of any drugs without a valid prescription; and no possession of any firearms.

Defendant Edward H Stray in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 37  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Edward H Stray not in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 2/11/15 @ 1 PM
